Why miniature?

Since the incident in '97, I see markets from a 1:87 scale. Turns out, when you're 2.3 inches tall, a penny looks like a manhole cover and a dollar bill is a queen-sized mattress.

That perspective changes everything. I don't see "small caps." I see skyscrapers. Your $47 emergency fund? To me, that's generational wealth.

I've managed $340M in assets from inside this globe. My overhead is literally zero. My office is a ceramic park bench next to a tiny ceramic Christmas tree. I pay no rent. I am the most efficient financial advisor in North America.

Frequently Asked Purrestions

Q: Is Nana actually inside a snow globe?
Yes. It's a 4-inch Hallmark globe from 1996, "Winter Wonderland" edition. The ceramic bench is uncomfortable but she's had 29 years to get used to it. The snow never settles. She has accepted this.
Q: How did she get miniaturized?
Lab accident. 1997. Fort Meade. She won't elaborate and we respect that. Her NDA is also miniature but still legally binding.
Q: Can she actually see my finances from in there?
The curvature of the glass creates a natural fisheye lens. Combined with her NSA training and 20/5 vision (a side effect of the shrinking), she can read a bank statement from across the room. She describes it as "like being inside a crystal ball, but with better interest rates."
Q: What happens if the globe breaks?
The globe is insured for $4.2 million through a policy Nana wrote herself. It is stored inside a locked Faraday cage in my granddaughter's bedroom. The cat is not allowed in that room. The cat knows this. The cat disagrees.
Q: Why is everything cat-themed?
Before the incident, Nana had 14 cats. She can no longer have cats. A single cat hair is now the size of a telephone pole to her. The branding is therapeutic. Please don't bring this up on calls.
Q: Do you accept clients outside of Topeka?
Nana serves clients in all 50 states. She doesn't travel (obviously) but she can see surprisingly far through the glass. International clients require the Apex Purredator tier because the time zone math gives her a headache.
